description.narrative: The project title is improving access to justice through human rights education and community mediation-IAJHRECM. Direct Rights holders are 112,274 (female 64,281 and male 47,993). The project will implement in 3 districts like Rangpur, Tangail and Barisal.  The goal is to the people of Bangladesh, particularly the women, are enjoying equal rights and justice. The objective of the project is to men and women, specially marginalized community are able to enforce their rights and access to gender responsive law and human rights. The project will address access to justice for the poor men and women. In rural area of Bangladesh, a disproportionately large number of conflicts arise from land dispute. Women are experiencing multiple forms of mental and physical violence. They are subject to discrimination and violence within the family, work place and society. Poor people especially rural women hardly have access to formal justice system. Particularly women, have less involvement in village court and arbitration council. The other structure of traditional mediation reflects the unequal class and gender hierarchy that characterized the existing social norms. Women are not only prevented from making their voice heard in a traditional mediation. The results are community mediation and litigation support for the community people, institutionalized community forum, mobilized community forum to response human rights violations and government social-safety-net programmes. Major activities are facilitating 4644 community mediation, 516 community group discussions and 516 quarterly cultural performances. Conducting 60 investigations, 57 litigation and 72 legal counselling.Organizing 258 and  24 half-yearly meeting with CRG and GWLN at union and upazilla level. Organizing training on facilitation skill and organizational development, gender, family law, mediation and human rights for unions and upazilla forum members, local and national level advocacy meetings.
This project mainly contributes to results within Fulfilment of women's rights. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
